meanings.definition: Warn (someone) in advance of a danger or problem.
meanings.sent1: I will forewarn you about the storm approaching.
meanings.sent2: It is important to forewarn hikers about the slippery trail ahead.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to forewarn his friends about the approaching cat.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl would always forewarn the other animals of any danger in the forest.
meanings.sent5: She decided to forewarn her classmates about the upcoming pop quiz to help them prepare.

meanings.sent1: Please forewarn me if you plan to arrive late.
meanings.sent2: The lifeguard will forewarn swimmers if there is a shark in the water.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to forewarn the audience about his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: The old lighthouse would forewarn sailors of the dangerous rocks ahead.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will forewarn the students about the fire drill scheduled for tomorrow.
